alert.note: Alert for Owyhee; Twin Falls (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 12:16PM MDT until further notice by NWS Boise
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Idaho and southwest Idaho, including the following counties, in south central Idaho, Twin Falls. In southwest Idaho, Owyhee. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1216 PM MDT, Thunderstorms will again develop this afternoon and evening bring heavy rainfall, gusty winds and small hail. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inch of rain has fallen the last couple of days. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rogerson, Salls Crossing, Crawfish Crossing, Juniper Butte, Middle Butte, Three Creek, Murphy Hot Springs, Poison Butte, Black Butte, Coonskin Butte, Clover Butte, Sevy Falls, Cedar Creek Reservoir, Black Rock Mountain, Black Rock Crossing, Bruneau River Launch Site, China Mountain, Black Stone Mountain, Monument Butte and Salmon Falls Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
